text.*:
Mrugavani National Park
IUCN category II (national park)
Pied Cuckoo at Mrugavani National Park
Location in Telangana, India
Show map of Telangana
Mrugavani National Park (India)
Show map of India
Location Chilkur near Hyderabad, Telangana
Nearest city Hyderabad
Coordinates 17°21′19″N 78°20′17″E﻿ / ﻿17.355228°N 78.338159°E﻿ / 17.355228; 78.338159Coordinates: 17°21′19″N 78°20′17″E﻿ / ﻿17.355228°N 78.338159°E﻿ / 17.355228; 78.338159
Area 1,211 acres (4.90 km2)

Mrugavani National Park is a national park located in Hyderabad, Telangana State. It is situated at Chilkur in Moinabad mandal, 20 km from MGBS and covers an area of 3.6 square kilometres (1.4 sq mi) or 1211 acres. It is home to a 600 different types of plant life. The Park is home to around 350 spotted deers. The animals include: indian hare, forest cat, civet, Indian rat snake, Russell's viper, cheetal and the flower pecker.[1][2]

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Flora
  • 3 Fauna
  • 4 Location
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References
  • 7 External links

History[edit]

It was declared as a National Park in 1994.

Flora[edit]

Teak, Bamboo, Sandal, Picus, Palas, Rela.

Fauna[edit]

Cheetal, Sambar, Wild boar, Jungle Cat, Civet Cat, Mongoose Monitor Lizard, Python, Russell Viper, King Cobra

Location[edit]

The Park is in near Chilkur Balaji Temple, about 20 km by road from MGBS

See also[edit]

  • Mahavir Harina Vanasthali National Park
  • Jawahar Deer Park

References[edit]

  1. ^ "Wild Life in Telangana :: Telangana Tourism". telanganatourism.gov.in. Retrieved 18 April 2018. 
  2. ^ Borah, Prabalika M. (11 January 2018). "Dear, how about some deer spotting?". Retrieved 18 April 2018 – via www.thehindu.com.
